It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a rosette pattern, contributing to its elegant appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Pollalesta klugii is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
